abstract: The billionaire Warren E. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway  reduced stakes in the health care company Johnson & Johnson and the consumer products company Procter & Gamble, as he found high-yielding investments elsewhere, and suffered big paper losses by holding onto investments in big United States financial companies.
lead_paragraph: The billionaire Warren E. Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway  reduced stakes in the health care company Johnson & Johnson and the consumer products company Procter & Gamble, as he found high-yielding investments elsewhere, and suffered big paper losses by holding onto investments in big United States financial companies.

headline.main: Buffett Shuffles Portfolio, Holding Firm on Financials
